Class WebRPC

Handles HTTP Rich Presence Requests

Syntax
[Obsolete("Rich Presence over HTTP is no longer supported by Discord. See offical Rich Presence github for more information.")]
public static class WebRPC

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

PrepareRequest(RichPresence, String, Int32)

Prepares a struct containing data requried to make a succesful web client request to set the rich presence.

Declaration
[Obsolete("WebRequests are no longer supported because of the removed HTTP functionality by Discord. See offical Rich Presence github for more information.")]
public static WebRequest PrepareRequest(RichPresence presence, string applicationID, int port = 6463)
Parameters
Type Name Description
RichPresence presence

The rich presence to set.
System.String applicationID

The ID of the application the presence belongs too.
System.Int32 port

The port the client is located on. The default port for the discord client is 6463, but it may move iteratively upto 6473 if the ports are unavailable.
Returns
Type Description
WebRequest

Returns a web request containing nessary data to make a POST request
| Improve this Doc View Source

SetRichPresence(RichPresence, String, Int32)

Sets the Rich Presence over the HTTP protocol. Does not support Join / Spectate and by default is blocking.

Declaration
[Obsolete("Setting Rich Presence over HTTP is no longer supported by Discord. See offical Rich Presence github for more information.")]
public static RichPresence SetRichPresence(RichPresence presence, string applicationID, int port = 6463)
Parameters
Type Name Description
RichPresence presence

The presence to send to discord
System.String applicationID

The ID of the application
System.Int32 port

The port the discord client is currently on. Specify this for testing. Will start scanning from supplied port.
Returns
Type Description
RichPresence

Returns the rich presence result from the server. This can be null if presence was set to be null, or if there was no valid response from the client.
| Improve this Doc View Source

The json data received by the client

Returns

System.Boolean

TrySetRichPresence(RichPresence, out RichPresence, String, Int32)

Attempts to set the Rich Presence over the HTTP protocol. Does not support Join / Specate and by default is blocking.

Declaration
[Obsolete("Setting Rich Presence over HTTP is no longer supported by Discord. See offical Rich Presence github for more information.")]
public static bool TrySetRichPresence(RichPresence presence, out RichPresence response, string applicationID, int port = 6463)
Parameters
Type Name Description
RichPresence presence

The presence to send to discord
RichPresence response

The response object from the client
System.String applicationID

The ID of the application
System.Int32 port

The port the discord client is currently on. Specify this for testing. Will start scanning from supplied port.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

True if the response was valid from the server, otherwise false.
